reference.shortdesc: The troubleshooting element is the top-level element for a troubleshooting topic. Troubleshooting topics provide information that enables readers to identify a condition, diagnose a cause, and potentially fix the problem.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: Troubleshooting topics begin with a description of a problem that the reader might want to correct. This can be followed by diagnostic information and possible solutions to the problem.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The troubleshooting element is specialized from topic. It is defined in the troubleshooting module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample contains a troubleshooting topic. The troubleshooting topic contains three troubleSolution elements that direct the user to perform sequential troubleshooting tasks: Resetting the alarm, reseating the system memory board, and replacing the memory board. Note that some steps are reused from other topics.
example.codeblock:
<msgph><msgnum>E247</msgnum>: Memory fault has occurred</msgph> The system has detected a memory problem.

The fault indicator flashes on the front panel, and the error log contains the E247 error message.

 p>A transient memory fault has occurred.

 System administrator From the systems management software, reset the alarm. Monitor the system periodically to see whether the alarm recurs.

A recurring memory fault indicates a possible problem with the system memory board.

 Maintenance technician

The system memory board might be corrupted.

 Certified technician. Note that work done by non-qualified individuals will void the product warranty.
